contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox football biography | name = Xavi Moré | image = | fullname = Xavier Moré Roca | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1982|6|7|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Barcelona]], [[Spain]] | height = {{height|m=1.84}} | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = | clubnumber = | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Real Valladolid|Valladolid]] | years1 = 2001–2004 | years2 = 2002–2005 | years3 = 2005–2007 | years4 = 2007–2009 | years5 = 2009–2013 | clubs1 = [[Real Valladolid B|Valladolid B]] | clubs2 = [[Real Valladolid|Valladolid]] | clubs3 = [[CD Castellón|Castellón]] | clubs4 = [[Pontevedra CF|Pontevedra]] | clubs5 = [[Real Oviedo|Oviedo]] | caps1 = | caps2 = 22 | caps3 = 69 | caps4 = 69 | caps5 = 105 | goals1 = | goals2 = 0 | goals3 = 3 | goals4 = 11 | goals5 = 17 | nationalyears1 = | nationalteam1 = | nationalcaps1 = | nationalgoals1 = | pcupdate = 15 June 2013 | ntupdate = }} {{spanish name 2|Moré|Roca}} '''Xavier 'Xavi' Moré Roca''' (born 7 June 1982 in [[Barcelona]], [[Catalonia]]) is a [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder|right midfielder]]. ==Football career== Moré first played professionally for [[Real Valladolid]] (where he was coached by his father, [[José Moré Bonet|José]]), but managed only seven [[La Liga|top flight]] appearances from 2002–04. On 19 January 2005 he had arguably his best moment with the [[Castile and León]] outfit, scoring in a 1–1 away draw against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] for [[2004–05 Copa del Rey|the season]]'s [[Copa del Rey|Spanish Cup]] and being essential as his team progressed to the quarterfinals on the [[away goals rule]].<ref>[http://hemeroteca.mundodeportivo.com/preview/2005/01/20/pagina-11/1366074/pdf.html Un catalán del Valladolid se carga a los galácticos coperos (Valladolid's Catalan man ousts Cup ''galácticos'')]; [[El Mundo Deportivo (newspaper)|El Mundo Deportivo]], 20 January 2005 {{es icon}}</ref> Moré then moved to [[CD Castellón]], being an undisputed starter for the [[Segunda División|second division]] team and also being managed by his father, and [[Pontevedra CF]] in the [[Segunda División B|third level]].<ref>[http://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/noticias/castellon/xavi-more-ficha-dos-anos-por-pontevedra_312725.html Xavi Moré ficha dos años por el Pontevedra (Xavi Moré signs for two years with Pontevedra)]; El Periódico Mediterráneo, 26 July 2007 {{es icon}}</ref> On 4 August 2009, after his link to the [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicians]] expired, he signed with another side in division three, [[Real Oviedo]].<ref>[http://www.realoviedo.es/weboficial/index.asp?Pagina=vernoticia&IdNoticia=3563 Xavi Moré, noveno fichaje del Real Oviedo (Xavi Moré, ninth Real Oviedo signing)]; Oviedo's official website, 4 August 2009 {{es icon}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.lfp.es/historico/primera/plantillas/historial.asp?jug=7173 Stats at Liga de Fútbol Profesional] {{es icon}} *[http://www.bdfutbol.com/en/j/j2651.html BDFutbol profile] *[http://www.futbolme.com/com/jugadores.asp?id_jugador=9160 Futbolme profile] {{es icon}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = More, Xavier | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = More, Xavi | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Spanish footballer | DATE OF BIRTH = 7 June 1982 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Barcelona, Spain | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:More, Xavier}} [[Category:1982 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Barcelona]] [[Category:Spanish footballers]] [[Category:Catalan footballers]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:La Liga footballers]] [[Category:Segunda División footballers]] [[Category:Segunda División B footballers]] [[Category:Tercera División footballers]] [[Category:Real Valladolid footballers]] [[Category:CD Castellón footballers]] [[Category:Pontevedra CF footballers]] [[Category:Real Oviedo players]]
